DOC.brief_title: Comparison Supportive Therapies Symptom Relief From Pediatric Upper Respiratory Infections ( URIs )
DOC.detailed_description: Study design nonblinded randomize control trial . It survey-based comparison study pediatric patient present Emergency Department ( ED ) upper respiratory infection ( URI ) symptoms ED physician recommend supportive care ( ie . non-prescription symptom relief ) . Study duration approximately one year . Subject participation duration 4 day . Subjects randomize 2 group : handheld humidifier group ( FDA clear medical device us distilled water ) & control group . Both group may use supportive modality desire over-the-counter cold medication ( OTCs ) , room air humidifier etc . Primary study objective determine use handheld humidifier improves URI symptom score ( nocturnal cough , parental perception ) and/or reduces use supportive modality compare control group relief pediatric URI symptom . Three survey obtain subject . The initial survey occur time enrollment ( T0 ) . The second third survey complete parent/guardian line phone first day ED visit ( T-1 ) sometime 2nd-4th day ED visit ( T-2 ) . The survey component include validate pediatric cough questionnaire 7 point Likert scale , question regard supportive treatment use symptom relief ( type , frequency result ) .
DOC.criteria: Ages 018 year old URI symptoms less 1 week duration . No new medication prescribe ED visit antipyretic refill routine medication ( ie . refill bronchodilator OK ) . Symptom severity score atleast 3 ( `` sometimes '' Likert 7 point scale ) least 2 survey question related symptom score ( cough frequency/severity , effect child 's sleep , effect parental sleep , combine symptom severity ) . Parent consent child must two valid form contact information ( ie . phone number email address ) order follow need completion 2nd 3rd survey . Parent consent child must access internet connection phone follow 24 day enrollment . Parent consent child must able fluently read speak English without use aide .
